name: Brazilian JiuJitsu Club
description:
What is Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu?

Brazilian Jiu Jitsu is a type of grappling martial art that is primarily focused on ground fighting and submissions. Because there are no exchanges of strikes (punches, kicks, etc) it is a safer martial arts to compete in.

 

---------------------------------------------------------------------

 

Our Mission:

The Primary mission of Texas A&M University Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu Club (TAMU BJJ Club) is to connect Texas A&M University students to others who practice, or would like to practice, Brazillian Jiu-Jitsu for both sport and self-defense. Through the participation in the TAMU BJJ Club, members will have the ability to increase physical fitness and hone self-defense skills through control maneuvers and leverage. This will build confidence in one’s ability through knowledge in the mind and strength in the body.

 

---------------------------------------------------------------------

 

Meeting times:

Sundays: 5:00pm - 6:00pm

Tuesdays: 5:00pm - 7:00pm

Thursdays: 5:00pm - 7:00pm

(Please check the Facebook page to ensure the meeting has not been canceled)

 

---------------------------------------------------------------------

 

Meeting location:

Texas A&M PEAP Building, Room 215

(Your student ID is required to access the building)
